answers.answer: A lot of women fail the 1st hour glucose test, and then some the 3 hour, my sister failed the three hour also by like 5-6 points, which isn't bad at all, so don't be too worried, they might just tell you to be on a specific diet and that could just regulate it throughout the rest of your pregnancy, sometimes all it takes to change is a change in diet, don't stress though! Good luck!
I agree with Kimberlee don't freak out just yet, I know someone who this happened to and they regulated it with their diet so they didn't have to take insulin. Good luck.
I'm sorry buddy. What is your next step what do you need to do from here?Hugs,AP
I sent you a message. I am on top of this GD thing now, so I'm sure I can help you out, give u advice.

Hi girls...I'm gonna stop freaking out now! Doc wants me to test my sugar at home with one of those finger stick meters 5 times a day! That's a lot of poking! Anyway, right away when I get up, stick my finger...write down the #..eat breakfast...2 hours later, stick my finger...write it down...eat lunch and repeat until I go to bed! So, I got all my supplies and bought a cute little note book to write it all down! Yesterday was just a little scary with people giving me horror stories and what I google'd! And candy is my enemy so Easter should be a hoot! I was tempted to buy all sugar-free candy for the kids so I could have some! But I didn't...ha ha! Hope you all stay well with our precious babies! We are gonna make it ladies!!! Happy Easter!

i haaaaated the finger pricking--got so stinkin sick of it, i'm totally averted to it now.  i'm really hoping i don't have GD this time around, but if I do i at least know that it's often really easy to control with diet--you just have to be disciplined.Keep us posted on your progress!
I think I missed this test,...another test that i missed.
lol, lis----i haven't gotten any of my bloodwork done yet, i missed my quad screen, i'm getting my first bloodwork done next week when i go to have my 1 hr glucose test.
just be thankful that you'll be "cured" of this terrible condition on the day that you deliver... some people have to live with diabetes for 30 years!hang in there!

Good luck ladies! It really isn't so bad. I have been watching what I eat, and have only caved on Easter (of course) and one other night I ate a piece of chocolate cake and that sent my sugar level up...but I had to do it! So, one day at a time and so far so good. I am a bit hungry because I am portion controlling to stay at 1800 calories! I see my doc on Thursday and he will discuss this GD with me some more. But I am surviving and even have dropped 3lbs since last Thursday! Not too bad!
same case here .. I failed the 3-hr test as well, got the results yesterday. Thinking about starting a few diet changes on my own before i even meet up with the dietitian. How is everyone else?

question: Well, I'm bummed. Doc's called and said at the end of the 3 hour test my blood sugar level was at 147 and normal would have been 140. So I now have gestational diabetes and I don't think I like it. I just read up on it and it kinda scares me! They said it was not like they said oh my gosh, this girl needs insulin...but a trip to the dietitian and 1800 calorie diet. Hopefully I won't have to stick my finger and report my levels all the time. I am afraid of having such a large baby that I can't deliver him. I read that sometimes the babies shoulders have to be broken or nerve damage occurs while trying to deliver! I just can't imagine this happening to my baby! I have not gained an obscene amount of weight...22 or 23 lbs and I have 10 weeks to go. So I hope he is not suffering being so hugh that we are in danger! I am waiting for them to call me back and tell me what Doc wants me to do...and in the mean time, I am freaking out! :O( Cari
